channel.title: CNET
channel.description: The latest tech news, product reviews, videos, and how tos from CNET.

item.title: Samsung Notebook 7 Spin review - CNET
item.description: It may not turn many heads, but this 15-inch Samsung laptop folds back on itself to become a full HD touchscreen tablet with high dynamic range.
item.dc:creator: Dan Ackerman

item.title: The top 5 best drones available today video - CNET
item.description: There are lot of drones out there and picking one can be difficult. These are the ones that stand out in the crowd.
item.dc:creator: Iyaz Akhtar

item.title: Tim Cook: I convinced myself Steve Jobs 'would bounce' - CNET
item.description: In a long interview with The Washington Post, Apple's CEO opens up about succeeding Jobs, the company's iPhone-dependency and who he turns to for advice.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Meyers

item.title: Yamaha's RX-V481 receiver an engaging performer video - CNET
item.description: The Yamaha RX-V481 receiver offers excellent bang-for-buck with its combination of must-have features and high-octane sonics.
item.dc:creator: Ty Pendlebury

item.title: IT departments driven batty by alerts - CNET
item.description: Technically Incorrect: And a startup called Big Panda aims to be the cure for notification-overload.
item.dc:creator: Chris Matyszczyk

item.title: Yamaha RV-X481 review - CNET
item.description: This receiver checks most of the must-have feature boxes, and still delivers excellent sound quality for a mid-price receiver.
item.dc:creator: Ty Pendlebury

item.title: SpaceX sticks another booster landing - CNET
item.description: The private space company sends a Japanese communications satellite into orbit early Sunday and recovers the first stage of that rocket on an offshore drone ship.
item.dc:creator: William Harwood

item.title: Pepper the humanoid robot knows how you feel video - CNET
item.description: This 4-foot-tall robot not only helps you find information, it has sensors that detect facial expressions to determine how you feel.
item.dc:creator: Lexy Savvides

item.title: Woman caught texting with hands, steering car with foot - CNET
item.description: Technically Incorrect: In Pennsylvania, a couple films a woman who relies on her New Balance shoe to balance her car.
item.dc:creator: Chris Matyszczyk

item.title: Trump launches web page to recruit 'election observers' - CNET
item.description: Technically Incorrect: What do you do when you think the election will be rigged? You recruit upstanding citizens on the web.
item.dc:creator: Chris Matyszczyk

item.title: No Man's Sky in VR? Someone did it. Sorta - CNET
item.description: Grab your barf bag.
item.dc:creator: Sharon Profis

item.title: Logitech Create is the best hardcore keyboard case for your iPad Pro video - CNET
item.description: Logitech's new backlit 9.7-inch iPad Pro keyboard case holds your pencil, too.
item.dc:creator: Scott Stein

item.title: Bitcoin's technology has a surprising fan: IBM - CNET
item.description: The technology may lead to smoother transactions and less disputes, which could ultimately mean lower prices and faster delivery for consumers.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: 2017 Honda Accord Hybrid: Three motors, no transmission (CNET On Cars, Episode 95) video - Roadshow
item.description: The new Accord Hybrid does one thing extremely well, we explain VTEC and why it's a legend, and we list the Top 5 infuriating things self-driving cars won't do.
item.dc:creator: Brian Cooley

item.title: A quick way to fix your internet connection and make it faster: Update your router's firmware - CNET
item.description: Updating a router's firmware can help improve or even repair a faulty internet connection.
item.dc:creator: Dong Ngo

item.title: Stranded in France: Two refugees tell their stories - CNET
item.description: Sohail Ahmed and Kamil Shamal no longer have to worry about the Taliban forces they fled, but life in the Jungle, a French refugee camp, brings other problems.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland

item.title: Invoxia Voice Bridge review - CNET
item.description: The Voice Bridge doesn't come with a monthly fee, but that means it also misses some features you may want.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Krol

item.title: After hack, more data on Democrats hits the web - CNET
item.description: In a data dump that appears to be linked to an earlier hack of a fund-raising group, US Congress members' personal email addresses and phone numbers land online.
item.dc:creator: Edward Moyer

item.title: Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Tablet has a mess of add-ons - CNET
item.description: Lenovo's new ThinkPad X1 tablet can be configured with a keyboard cover, complete with its signature red track-point button.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Krol

item.title: A modern washer to brighten up your boring laundry room video - CNET
item.description: LG's $1,150 WT1801HVA washing machine boasts next-gen style, but can it remove stains?
item.dc:creator: Megan Wollerton

item.title: Lights, camera, jam! The best biopics on musicians - CNET
item.description: The best biopics can take you inside the artist's head like no documentary can.
item.dc:creator: Steve Guttenberg

item.title: Kenny Baker, the actor inside Star Wars' beloved R2-D2, passes away - CNET
item.description: Baker, standing at 3 feet 8 inches tall, first hopped inside the shell of R2-D2 for 1977's "Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope."
item.dc:creator: Mike Sorrentino

item.title: Samsung Notebook 7 Spin is an HDR hybrid that even plays games video - CNET
item.description: Packed with features, this 15-inch hybrid does a lot, including a software version of HDR video for better movie-viewing.
item.dc:creator: Dan Ackerman

item.title: Making a splash in Rio: Robots snap underwater shots at Olympics - CNET
item.description: Getty photographer Adam Pretty captures some of the most memorable shots from the swimming pool at the Rio Olympics.
item.dc:creator: Terry Collins

item.title: How high-tech hand scanners unintentionally keep refugees from safety and shelter video - CNET
item.description: Technology designed to keep a French refugee camp safe hasn't worked out as planned.
item.dc:creator: Richard Trenholm
